item.title: Carbon cost of High Performance Computing
item.description: ARCHER pulls 1.2 MW [1] to run it’s 4920[1] compute nodes (each of which is 24 cores). That’s just under 250 W power per node, 6kWhr of energy in 24hrs. A 24 hour computer job consumes 8.6 ‘kAU’ in the internal compute units used for accounting. So that’s roughly 0.7 kwhr / kAU, or 700 kwhr / MAU. The UK electricity grid carbon intensity is roughly 400 g / kwhr averaged over the year.
